page.title: 12INTERVIEW WITH FARMER
page.content: { Mr.Campion}farms 230 acres arable land about \ mile off the main Kimbolton to Gt.Staughton Road at Gimbers End. Mr.Campion & his wife & teenage son & daughter moved into the farmhouse when his father left about 4 years ago. A row of several farm cottages were converted to form the present house. Mr.Campion works the farm apart from occassional help from one local man.He owns a combine, tractors, sprayer, beet harvester, silos & corn dryer. 160 acres are wheat, 25 barley, 10 hedges roads & river & on the remainder he grows sugarbeet, radish, parsnip, turnip & evening primrose for seed. 90% of the grain is sold for animal food. The EEC grain buying scheme led to an increase in acreage of grain from 10% to 50%.
